subject: Education
title: Peer Instruction: Learning by Explaining
description: A short lesson to help you apply Peer Instruction: Learning by Explaining.

hook.text: Harvard physics students learned more from arguing with each other than from lectures.

buildup.text: Eric Mazur's peer instruction asks students to convince a neighbor of their answer.

discovery.text: Explaining forces you to organize your thoughts and find gaps you didn't notice.

twist.text: The explainer often benefits more than the listener.

climax.text: Peer instruction works because fresh learners speak the same 'confusion language.'

punchline.text: Teaching is the deepest form of learning.

quiz.question: Why is peer instruction effective?
options: Explaining forces learners to organize their understanding
Students always trust peers more than teachers
It eliminates the need for any instructor involvement
